channel.title: Npcreset?

item.title: Npcreset?
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

that conflicting thing does work, but the command just does nothing
someone knows how to fix?

Read full topic

item.title: Npcreset?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

for the conflict, change
if(command.startsWith(“npc”)
to something like:
if(command.startsWith(“npc”) && !command.contains(“reset”));

Read full topic

item.title: Npcreset?
item.dc:creator: @Nerdaz Nerdaz
item.description:
@Nerdaz wrote:

Im working on an allstar project too, actually waiting to get a little help for mine.
I’m more of a beginner coder, so i can’t give the best way to fix it, but you could always name the command reset, and it should work as long as the rest of the code is correct. That should get around the other command

Read full topic

item.title: Npcreset?
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

i want to add a command but it just does nothing and i want to name it npcreset but then it conflicts with another command
named npc (the one where you spawn an npc) because it has exception (e) in it or something and because that command is
command.startsWith(“npc”);
but this is my command i got.
btw it’s allstar.

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("resetnpcs") && playerRights >= 3){ for (int i = 0; i < server.npcHandler.maxNPCs; i++) { if (server.npcHandler.npcs[i] != null) { server.npcHandler.npcs[i].IsDead = true; server.npcHandler.npcs[i].actionTimer = 0; PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ("System Message - Server npc reset"); } else { sendMessage("You are not a staff member"); } } }

Read full topic
